intro: Loncomelos ulixis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its helix-like flowers and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are twining and can reach lengths of several meters. Loncomelos ulixis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
